title: Who has sold the most albums? - Quora

response.answer_text: One more time, as soon as records sales are requested we see the same fanciful claims going on like “Thriller sold 110 million copies”. That is deeply wrong. No album ever came close to this number. Nor have albums like Back In Black, Bat Out Of Hell or Millennium sold 40 million plus. Wikipedia lists barely put together these wild claims so they are hardly helpful. These are the top 10 best selling studio albums in pure sales: 1. 1982 – Michael Jackson – Thriller – 65,800,000 2. 1973 – Pink Floyd – The Dark Side of the Moon – 43,300,000 3. 1992 – Whitney Houston – The Bodyguard – 41,100,000 4. 1978 – Various Artists – Grease – 38,100,000 5. 1971 – Led Zeppelin – Led Zeppelin IV – 36,800,000 6. 1980 – AC/DC – Back in Black – 35,810,000 7. 1977 – Fleetwood Mac – Rumours – 35,500,000 8. 1977 – Bee Gees & Various Artists – Saturday Night Fever – 34,800,000 9. 1987 – Michael Jackson – Bad – 33,600,000 10. 1995 – Alanis Morissette – Jagged Little Pill – 33,570,000 Full top 100 available here at Chartmasters. As someone who has been studying the music industry for more than 15 years, I have to point out that pure sales of original albums are not as meaningful as people tend to believe. The perception of success of top selling albums is often inflated as they went so high thanks to the absence of a competing compilation. For example, Queen’s A Night At The Opera would be undoubtedly much closer to sales of the likes Led Zeppelin I, Metallica’s black album or Pink Floyd’s Wish you Were Here if it wasn’t for the release of their 1981 Greatest Hits that truncated its legs. Then, the real question is about the “most successful” album rather than “top album seller”. At Chartmasters.org, we built the CSPC, Commensurate Sales to Popularity Concept, to account for that. All big selling albums have been studied. The concept goes into every record from a catalog, weight all formats on par with albums and sum everything. The most successful British bands are listed below, the date is the date of the last audit. The top 10 then shows as listed below: 1. 1982 – Michael Jackson – Thriller – 116,732,000 2. 1976 – Eagles – Hotel California – 70,575,000 3. 1977 – Bee Gees & Various Artists – Saturday Night Fever – 67,150,000 4. 1987 – Michael Jackson – Bad – 62,899,000 5. 1977 – Fleetwood Mac – Rumours – 61,258,000 6. 1980 – AC/DC – Back in Black – 58,224,000 7. 1971 – Led Zeppelin – Led Zeppelin IV – 57,016,000 8. 1973 – Pink Floyd – The Dark Side of the Moon – 55,796,000 9. 1992 – Whitney Houston – The Bodyguard – 53,744,000 10. 1991 – Nirvana – Nevermind – 52,930,000 Full top 100 available here.
